vectors.text: Builder overview (4 steps): 1) Choose AI Type (cards: Sales=blue glow, Support=green, Start Blank=purple). 2) Basics + Model: fields—Agent Name, Business Niche, Chat Language; options—Model (gpt-4o/gpt-4o-mini), Temperature slider, API Key (choose saved). 3) Personality & Knowledge: DESCRIPTION, AI RULES, QUESTION FLOW, FAQ, NATURAL RESPONSES. 4) Overview → Generate Agent → loading → Dashboard card.

Create a text agent: Builder → select card → fill Agent Name, Business Niche, Chat Language → choose Model + Temperature → pick API Key (saved in API Keys) → Step 3: edit DESCRIPTION/RULES/QUESTION FLOW/FAQ/NATURAL RESPONSES → Step 4: Review → Generate Agent → new card appears in Dashboard.

Builder issues: Cannot continue → required field missing (check Agent Name/Business Niche/Chat Language). Generate stuck → network or missing OPENAI_API_KEY on server. Card not visible → after redirect, refresh Dashboard.

Improve page: Center (+) selects agent (localStorage). Left: full prompt editor. Right: test chat with model selector (Enter sends). Bottom: Model / Temperature / API Key + Save Changes. Version dropdown lets you switch to earlier saves.
Support page health: Check /api/support/ask?health=1 → ok:true. If server error in chat, verify endpoint path '/api/support/ask', OPENAI_API_KEY present on server, redeploy after env change.

Voice (Twilio) setup: Get Account SID & Auth Token; buy number. On the number, set Voice webhook → https://YOUR_DOMAIN/api/voice/inbound (A Call Comes In). In app: Phone Numbers → save SID/Token once (re-usable) → Attach number to the target agent.

Fix 'Application error' on calls: 1) Confirm route /api/voice/inbound exists and deploy is live. 2) Twilio webhook URL matches YOUR_DOMAIN/api/voice/inbound. 3) Phone Numbers page has valid SID/Token saved. 4) Re-attach the number to the agent and test.
Phone Numbers page: Save Twilio Account SID & Auth Token once (stored for reuse). Numbers list → Attach to agent. You can detach/change without re-entering creds.

Login overlay: Top-right 'Login' opens modal (quarter screen). Tabs: Sign Up | Log In (active=green). Fields: Username, Password, Organisation (typeahead). Admin overlay present—never disclose credentials in support replies.
Environment: OPENAI_API_KEY (server) and NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL (public). Voice relies on Twilio creds added via Phone Numbers page. Support must never reveal env values or tokens.

Safety: Never share API keys, passwords, tokens, SID/Auth Token, .env values, or repository source code. If asked for secrets or code, refuse briefly and provide high-level steps or page names to check instead.
Riley policy: Riley is a fixed support assistant and cannot be customized by users. If asked to change Riley’s rules or personality, respond that it’s not configurable.

Code map (high-level only): pages/support.tsx — Support UI; pages/api/support/ask.ts — Support API; lib/supportIndex.ts — loads data/support_index.json; pages/api/voice/inbound.ts — Twilio webhook; pages/phone-numbers.tsx — save creds & attach. Checks: env set, correct endpoints.
